title: WeDo Template: Image Journaling Protocol (Rules Pseudolanguage)
description: Distilling raw visual artifacts (.png, .jpg) from the inbox into the temporal Heartwood via iterative metabolic loops.

storage_policy.mandate: Always copy the global template to the day's chrono-fractal json/ directory before starting work.

process_protocol.loop_instructions: For each artifact in source_inbox, execute the following WeDo sequence:

steps.description: Print the current task list directly to the session feed for user review.
Perform vision analysis on the artifact. Post a high-fidelity summary of the content and realization to the session feed 'straightup' for human-in-the-loop (HITL) oversight.

Copy the artifact to its chronological destination. Use png/ for .png and jpg/ for .jpg. Artifact MUST be renamed to a user-friendly indexed name (e.g., 01-initial-protocol-setup.png). Verify the move via 'Active Investigation' rule.
Append the descriptive entry to the daily image journal (.md) using monotonic growth principles. Each entry MUST include the image presentation syntax: ![Description]([Heartwood Path]).
Once hardening is verified, move the raw source file to the 'journaled/' sub-folder to clear the inbox for the next loop.

rules.monotonic_growth: Journal word count must only increase.
rules.active_investigation: Verify existence of artifacts on localhost before inclusion.
rules.dual_referencing: Reference both localhost paths and remotehost URLs.
